text: busted a neighbor cat pooping in my raised vegetable bed this morning
after i yelled at him for starting to dig up our gravel patio
didn’t realize we just installed a patio / massive litter box
Netting can help keep them out

<@U0K8ZSHN0> You may have tried this already but I’ve had big catch couch scratching problems and they completely stopped when I got The Ultimate Scratching Post. Then he never scratched anything else. My mom has one too and her cats love it just as much.
ugh i bought that for my cat and she never touched it
My cats needs a basic cardboard scratching pad. It gets everywhere, but he needs to feel like he’s ripping something up.
i have this, which my cats LOVE <https://www.amazon.com/PetFusion-Scratcher-Cardboard-Construction-unverified/dp/B004X6UEH6>
but it doesn’t satisfy my one cat’s need for vertical scratching
but it does look pretty good for a cat scratcher
My younger cats love all the scratching posts I got them. Mainly the oldest cat doesn't give a shit
We hadn't clipped their claws in a while

I haven’t tried it, but this might be a good option:
<https://www.amazon.com/SmartyKat-Scratch-Scratcher-Corrugate-Hanging/dp/B009YQ5KJM/ref=sr_1_1?s=pet-supplies&ie=UTF8&qid=1472677092&sr=1-1&keywords=door+cat+scratcher>
One of our cat towers has a 4 ft high rope one that they all love
yeah my cats dont give a shit about rope, they’re all about that cardboard
Murphy doesn’t mind rope, but Lazo also needs cardboard. Every cat it different.
